cab.content: E.L.S. 1557.SECRETPARIS 1st January 1918,NOTE FROM COLONEL SPIERS FOR COLONEL FAGA IDE.RUSSIA AFrom General Niessel, December 29th, pointing out the danger whieh may result from relying on American action in Russia. So far, the Amerloans have been unable to exeraise any effective action even as regards the railways;, for five months they have failed to secure effective control even over the Trans-Siberian line,.General Niessel considers it most necessary that French action should be continued with a competent personnel which understands the situation until such time as the Americans are in a position to act.C32'
